title: Machine Learning Engineer - Computer Vision
description:
The Role: We're looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer with a deep background in computer vision and generative AI. You’ll be part of a team developing systems that generate realistic, diverse, and highly controllable synthetic image data using state-of-the-art tools like Stable Diffusion, LoRA, and ControlNet. Your work will directly impact the performance and robustness of real-world AI systems—from self-driving cars to defense robotics.
What You’ll Do
 Develop and fine-tune generative AI pipelines (e.g., Stable Diffusion, ControlNet, LoRA) for synthetic image generation.
 Design and implement machine learning workflows to generate structured, photorealistic datasets.
 Collaborate with 3D artists and simulation engineers to align ML models with physical environments and sensor setups.
 Work closely with customers in automotive, robotics, and aerospace to deliver tailored datasets.
 Optimize generation systems for scalability, quality, and speed using tools like ComfyUI or custom pipelines.
 
You Should Have
 MSc or PhD in Computer Vision, Machine Learning, or related field.
 3+ years of hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow).
 Experience working with generative AI models (especially diffusion-based models).
 Familiarity with tools like LoRA, ControlNet, ComfyUI, or custom workflows around Stable Diffusion.
 Strong understanding of synthetic data generation and its role in training perception systems.
 A track record of deploying ML systems in domains like automotive, robotics, defense, or manufacturing.
 
Nice to Have
 Experience working with 3D simulation pipelines or sensor modeling (e.g., depth, LiDAR, segmentation).
 Contributions to open-source ML/gen AI tools or custom diffusion model training.
 Enjoying reading research papers
 A problem solving intellect and a team player spirit
 Knowledge of synthetic-to-real domain adaptation techniques.
 Experience in startup environments or working directly with enterprise R&D teams.
 A positive can-do attitude

title: AI & Robotics Scientist
description:
At Applied AI, we develop exciting new AI solutions in innovative projects, we strengthen research, industry and the public sector. We create positive effects on society through technological development together with external partners and access to the latest research.
About the role We are looking for an AI & Robotics Scientist with strong expertise across data science, robotics, and software engineering to drive the next generation of data-driven industrial automation solutions. With a proven background in model-driven engineering, applied machine learning, and interdisciplinary research, you will play a key role in transforming industrial data into actionable insights, optimizing processes, and bridging the gap between AI innovation and operational deployment.
 This role is ideal for someone who combines curiosity, technical knowledge, and hands-on experience across academia and industry. Someone who thrives in working at the intersection of research, engineering, and applied data science.
Your responsibilities include:
 Lead the development of machine learning and AI models for automation use cases such as predictive maintenance, mission assurance, and process optimization.
 Design and implement knowledge-driven approaches (e.g., knowledge graphs, model-driven engineering) to improve data reusability, verifiability, and interpretability.
 Architect and manage data pipelines integrating IoT sensors, robotics systems, and industrial control environments.
 Translate advanced data science methods (e.g., statistical modeling, graph analytics, optimization) into robust, real-world industrial applications.
 Collaborate with cross-disciplinary teams (automation engineers, researchers, industry partners) to align analytics solutions with operational goals.
 Mentor colleagues, contribute to capacity building, and supervision experience to strengthen organizational knowledge.
 Contribute to research and innovation projects (e.g., EU/Vinnova/Energimyndigheten) by preparing technical content, and reports.
 Act as a bridge between academic insights and industrial practice, ensuring that innovative methods are practical, explainable, and industry-ready.
 
About you
 You have a PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Robotics, or Automation Engineering.
 You enjoy working across domains, from robotics and automation to data-intensive applications.
 You have a proven ability to communicate complex ideas clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
 You thrive in collaborative environments, with experience across academia, industry, or applied projects.
 You are motivated by turning research into practice, ensuring that advanced methods lead to real-world impact.
 
What we would hope you know
 Hands-on expertise in machine learning, statistical modeling, and optimization techniques.
 Strong programming skills in Python (including Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow/PyTorch, NetworkX).
 Familiarity with robotics and automation systems, including mission design, or control theory.
 Understanding of industrial data sources and protocols (time-series sensor data, OPC UA, MQTT, KPIs).
 Experience in data visualization and analysis for decision-making and reporting.
 
Other qualifications
 Experience with knowledge graphs, ontologies, and semantic data technologies.
 Generative and agentic AI
 
About the position and application The position is a permanent position with a six-month probation period. Our office is centrally located at Chalmers and you are offered a hybrid solution where you have the opportunity to alternate office work with work from home.
 Application deadline: 30th of September Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and we will place great emphasis on personal suitability in the appointment.
We would like you to attach / write a personal letter together with your application (CV).
We offer At Chalmers Industrial Technology, we offer a dynamic and innovative environment and a role in an exciting and growing business with a focus on problem solving, where you are involved in influencing tomorrow. We take advantage of your skills but also your desire to develop. 
 About us Stiftelsen Chalmers Industriteknik is a research and development organization dedicated to driving innovation for a sustainable society. We are a passionate team of innovators, researchers, and project managers driven by the desire to make a difference for the future. By enhancing Sweden's capacity for innovation and making research accessible, we work to shape a better and more sustainable world. We are preparing tomorrow for the future.
